version_description:
This is primarily a bug fix release.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

We fixed a bug that was causing the app to freeze up for some users. Have anything else you’d like to suggest? We’d love to hear from you.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

3D Touch added to the app icon. Start a test, view your result history, or share your last test result - right from the app icon.
Full IPv6 Support - IP address exhaustion crisis averted. At least as far as we're concerned.
There was a bug when saving a Speedtest result image. That bug's name was Louie, and we smashed him to smithereens. RIP Louie. Candlelight vigil details to follow.

We've discovered a crash on iOS 7 in this release - please wait to update until the next release. We've also updated our privacy policy.

We fixed a couple of crashes for users on iOS 7. We've also updated our privacy policy.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

We've made some enhancements to our testing engine and took care of a few bugs.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

Introducing the new Speedtest for iOS!

All-new design and improved user experience with support for iPhone X
Speedtest now measures packet loss & jitter
Easier server selection with built-in search
Adjust the scale of the Speedtest gauge
Improved map view shows where you’ve taken tests
Rate your ISP or operator

We hope you enjoy the new Speedtest and welcome your feedback in the Help screen of the app, or a review in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

4.0.1
Fixed a coupla whoopsies that are all too common with big honkin' releases. Speaking of big honkin' releases, get a load of this BHR:

4.0
Introducing the new Speedtest for iOS!

All-new design and improved user experience with support for iPhone X
Speedtest now measures packet loss & jitter
Easier server selection with built-in search
Adjust the scale of the Speedtest gauge
Improved map view shows where you’ve taken tests
Rate your ISP or operator

We hope you enjoy the new Speedtest and welcome your feedback in the Help screen of the app, or a review in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

Fixed a rare crash that could occur if you changed speed units after deleting a result.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

Speedtest 4.02 includes various improvements and fixes, based on your feedback.
* Added ability to change gauge display speed to kB/s
* Swipe right to go back to the previous screen in app
* Made it easier to change a server and to pick a favorite server
* Some localization fixes
* Various bug fixes

We hope you enjoy the new Speedtest and welcome your feedback in the Help screen of the app, or a review in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

Put your iPhone X to work with a black theme
Added a more obvious Change Server button
You might notice readability adjustments, too

Thanks for your feedback!
Really, it helps us constantly improve
If you have additional comments, leave a review
By the way, we have a form in the app as well
Unless you think the app is totally perfect
Then maybe consider our Mac/Windows app
Either way, happy testing!

4.0.4:
Fixed a few bugs and a crash.

4.0.3:
Put your iPhone X to work with a black theme
Added a more obvious Change Server button
You might notice readability adjustments, too

Thanks for your feedback!
Really, it helps us constantly improve
If you have additional comments, leave a review
By the way, we have a form in the app as well
Unless you think the app is totally perfect
Then maybe consider our Mac/Windows app
Either way, happy testing!

Fixed a rare crash that could occur if you changed speed units after deleting a result.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

This update includes improved privacy controls.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

This update includes improved privacy controls.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

Notes!
Many have asked for the ability to leave a note about a particular test. Now you can add a note from the results detail screen. Great for optimizing your home wifi ("1st floor", "Kitchen", "New Router"), differentiating test locations ("home", "school", "work"), or whatever else you might find useful!

We've also optimized the server selection process so you can start tests even faster.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

—修复了少量错误。

Fixed an issue where many of you were having to review your privacy options every time. Sorry about that, and thanks for the feedback.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

New Features (and some bug fixes)!

*Single Connection Testing*

Speedtest uses multiple connections to determine your fastest potential speed. Now, you can also take a single-connection test that's great for simulating a single file download. Try both testing methods and get a better understanding of your connection speed and quality!

*VPN Connection Detection*

We've also added the ability to determine if you are connected to a VPN, and we default to a single-connection test in that case. Switching back to multi-connection is a simple toggle before your test.

Finally, we've fixed some bugs to make testing more accurate and reliable.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

New Features (and some bug fixes)!

- Single Connection Testing: Speedtest uses multiple connections to determine your fastest potential speed. Now, you can also take a single-connection test, which is great for simulating a single file download. Try both testing methods and get a better understanding of your connection speed and quality!

- VPN Connection Detection: We've also added the ability to determine if you are connected to a VPN, and we default to a single-connection test in that case. Switching back to multi-connection is a simple toggle before your test.

- Finally, we've fixed some bugs to make testing more accurate and reliable.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

This update includes improvements to our 5G connection identification. Have anything else you'd like to suggest? We'd love to hear from you.

If you rely on Speedtest to diagnose connectivity issues and keep your Internet service provider and carriers honest, we'd be thrilled if you would leave us some feedback in the App Store. Thanks and happy testing!

We've added a few updates to make the Speedtest app even better. Have anything else you'd like to suggest? We'd love to hear from you.
